overview: This economy-minded Columbia backstage musical opens with overly fussy director-choreographer Eddie Dolan (wartime star-substitute Fred Brady) in exigent mode, much in the Cole manner. Closing the movie are two archetypal Cole numbers: a perfect capture of his nightclub rhumba routine (using costumes that also appear in Tonight and Every Night) and a backyard tomboy-romp that morphs into a waltz, one of Coleâ€™s oft-repeated themes. -Museum of Modern Art
tagline: A Dream of a Musical about Love's Young Dream!
title: Meet Me on Broadway
